intro: Potentilla glendzinskii, commonly known as the Glendzinskii cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are compound, with five leaflets, and it produces fruit in the form of a dry, capsule. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
